Module Robotinterface
Package robotinterface.cmd

Interface Commander

All Known Implementing Classes:
SimCommander
public interface Commander

Interface of objects that send commands to the robot controller. A respective instance support the user to remote control a robot. E.g. send a command to navigate to a certain positon. It is expected, this is done via single-line text commands, thus part processing is to parse and understand a command.

There are several ways conceivable to issue a command, i.g. use a remote shell console, send a command via TCP or read it from a file.
Author:
Jörg Roth (Joerg.Roth@Wireless-earth.org)

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    int currentCommandNumber()
    Return the ordering number of the currently executed command (1, 2, ...).
    void failure()
    Indicate, the overall command execution was a failure.
    boolean hasCommandListener()
    Return if there currently is a listener registered.
    void inject​(java.lang.String command)
    Programmatically insert a command, in the same way, the user had enter it.
    void println​(java.lang.String line)
    Transmits a text line to the Commander.
    void printStackTrace​(java.lang.Exception e)
    Prints the stack trace related to the exception to the Commander.
    void registerCommandListener​(CommandListener listener)
    Register a listener to commands.
    void success()
    Indicate, the overall command execution was a success.
    void unregisterCommandListener​(CommandListener listener)
    Unregister a listener to asynchronous messages from the Commander If the listener formerly was not registered, nothing happens.

  • Method Details

    • registerCommandListener

      void registerCommandListener​(CommandListener listener)
      Register a listener to commands.
      Parameters:
      listener - object that is informed when asynchronous messages appear from the Commander

    • unregisterCommandListener

      void unregisterCommandListener​(CommandListener listener)
      Unregister a listener to asynchronous messages from the Commander If the listener formerly was not registered, nothing happens.
      Parameters:
      listener - object that is not informed anymore when asynchronous messages appear from the Commander

    • hasCommandListener

      boolean hasCommandListener()
      Return if there currently is a listener registered.
      Returns:
      true, if there is a listener

    • println

      void println​(java.lang.String line)
      Transmits a text line to the Commander.
      Parameters:
      line - text line

    • printStackTrace

      void printStackTrace​(java.lang.Exception e)
      Prints the stack trace related to the exception to the Commander.
      Parameters:
      e - an exception

    • success

      void success() throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
      Indicate, the overall command execution was a success. After this, the reply token is not valid anymore.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - if currently there is no command executed

    • failure

      void failure() throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
      Indicate, the overall command execution was a failure. After this, the reply token is not valid anymore.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - if currently there is no command executed

    • currentCommandNumber

      int currentCommandNumber()
      Return the ordering number of the currently executed command (1, 2, ...).
      Returns:
      command ordering number, -1 if currently there is no command executed

    • inject

      void inject​(java.lang.String command)
      Programmatically insert a command, in the same way, the user had enter it.
      Parameters:
      command - the command string
